solution_line_template: Ten dozens of watermelons are equal to {initial_dozens} x {items_per_dozen} = <<{initial_dozens}*{items_per_dozen}={total_watermelons}>>{total_watermelons} watermelons.
So, there are only {total_watermelons} - {sold_yesterday} = <<{total_watermelons}-{sold_yesterday}={remaining_after_yesterday}>>{remaining_after_yesterday} watermelons left for today.
Hence, {remaining_after_yesterday} - {sold_today} = <<{remaining_after_yesterday}-{sold_today}={left_for_tomorrow}>>{left_for_tomorrow} watermelons are left to be sold tomorrow.
